{"step_by_step_thinking": "The onset of puberty is a complex process that involves a variety of hormones. GnRH, or gonadotropin-releasing hormone, is a key player in initiating puberty, but it is not considered to have a permissive action. Leptin, on the other hand, is a hormone produced by fat cells that has been found to have a permissive role in the onset of puberty.
